data.title: Awesome small business
data.text: My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch on a Saturday. The employees were very warm and inviting. They showed us the buffet. It had numerous options. But we chose to order off the menu. The server was informative and helped me choose. The food was very tasty. I had the Gyro Meat Hummus with fresh pita bread. It was wonderful. The service was very personable. Great experience. We will return  soon.

data.title: Good lunchtime buffet, plus groceries
data.text: The lunch buffet is very good, and has many vegetarian selections. I suggest the hummus, the baba ganoush, cauliflower, and dolmathes. The gyro was average. Very friendly staff. Recently, was renamed Olive Branch Mediterranean Restaurant and Grocery. You can buy some groceries here, such as pita bread, condiments, etc. Come for lunch and get ingredients for a home-cooked meal.

data.title: Above average lunch buffet with exceptional hummus
data.text: The buffet here wasn't overwhelming, but it was good. Several rice options, and 4-5 various meats. Nothing was labeled however, so it was a bit hard to figure out what was what. The real exception to the average-nature was the homemade hummus, which was exceptional. Worth a visit, though I might try a plate next time rather than the buffet.

data.title: Visiting college
data.text: We were happy the sign outside said "Halal". Small place but had meat we could eat. The buffet took a little while to open but wish we would have ordered it.! Looked yummy! We ordered sandwiches that tasted great. Food took a little long but it was worth it. Quite a few people came when they opened.Teens loved the fries. The Gyro I ate was delicious. The temperature of the establishment was a little warm. Was happy the sold some groceries we could purchase. Was right near the university so I'm sure we will be back.

data.title: Great BUFFET!
data.text: Excellent buffet with a variety of middle eastern dishes. Often refreshed and at the right temperature. Very flavorful and always packed with patrons. Staff always helpful in explaining the dishes and are warm and welcoming.

data.title: Delivery
data.text: I recently had food from here delivered to work so I cannot say anything regarding atmosphere. I ordered a gyro, which was okay, but a friend let me try her chicken shwarma and it was awesome. Very flavorful, rich with Mediterranean spices. It comes surrounded by humus, which went very well with the dish. The price wasn't bad. I would recommend to skip the gyro and try the chicken shwarma.

data.title: Excellent food, well-presented
data.text:
This was my first time to the Olive Cafe and Grocery; my husband had been before.  There are about 12 tables/booths.  The atmosphere is plain, but pleasant.  Diners can look out onto busy Providence Rd. if they wish, or just enjoy the quiet of the cafe.

I had a chicken plate; he had the kofta plate.  Both were just right. The chef had taken great care to arrange the meal so that it was a pleasure to see it and anticipate the taste. There was a small amount of hot pepper sauce that could be mixed in to taste--it really added to the dishes.  The pita bread is the best we've had in Columbia.
We had enough food that we took about half home and added an order of baba ganoush to go with it for the next day's lunch.

The only downside was the less-than-enthusiastic waitress.  When ordering, I asked what herbs/spices are in the hummus chicken shawarma plate because I'm allergic to basil.  She didn't know and wasn't interested in finding out what was in it.  She couldn't bring me a sample to sniff because it is already in the dish.  She wasn't busy, just not "into being a waitress" by behavior.

The food, however, was so very good, that we will be back.  I'll do a little research on ingredients, then perhaps I can order from a broader selection on the menu.
